verses.roman:
'ātmā' śabde 'mana' kaha--mane yei rame
sādhu-saṅge seha bhaje śrī-kṛṣṇa-caraṇe

synonyms: ātmā—ātmā; śabde-by the word; mana—the mind; kaha—if you say; mane—within the mind; yei rame—one who is satisfied by speculation; sādhu-saṅge—by the association of devotees; seha—he also; bhaje—takes to devotional service; śrī-kṛṣṇa-caraṇe—at the lotus feet of Lord Kṛṣṇa.
translation: "The word ātmā sometimes means 'the mind.' In this case, the word ātmārāma means 'a person who is satisfied by mental speculation.' When such a person associates with a pure devotee, he takes to devotional service at the lotus feet of Kṛṣṇa.
